cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northeast on Friday, cross the southern-central Florida Peninsula Saturday, then accelerate into the western Atlantic toward the Carolinas and Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern / central Florida Peninsula (likely near or just south of Fort Myers – West Palm Beach corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County line (includes Brevard County south of the line, the Keys, and west coast south of Longboat Key)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southern and portions of central Florida Gulf and Atlantic coasts, including Brevard County, Keys, and adjacent offshore waters
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (main 4+ inch totals confined to South Florida)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Saturday as the center crosses the peninsula
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, generally below 2 ft above ground
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Saturday, locally higher in squalls, could produce brief localized flooding at port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip-currents beginning late Friday night; lightning in outer rainbands may intermittently halt cargo operations
